snippet: An analysis of the N.C.A.A. tournament championship game between Louisville and Michigan, based on concepts of sport psychology like big-game experience, leadership behind the bench, leadership on the court, error control and consistency.
abstract: An analysis of the N.C.A.A. tournament championship game between Louisville and Michigan, based on concepts of sport psychology like big-game experience, leadership behind the bench, leadership on the court, error control and consistency.

byline.original: By CARLTON J. CHIN and JAY P. GRANAT

headline.main: Keeping Score: Which Team Has the Stats of a Champion?
